sentences.english: Some people's fear of marriage can be traced back to their parents' divorce. ;
sentences.chinese: 一些人对婚姻的惊骇可以追溯到他们怙恃的仳离。

sentences.english: During his childhood, he sang in church with his parents.
sentences.chinese: 孩提期间，他与怙恃一路在教堂里唱歌。

sentences.english: students attend a boarding school would cultivate their independence as apart from their parents.
sentences.chinese: 分开怙恃上寄宿黉舍的学生将会培育他们的自力性。

sentences.english: The Lunar New Year, my family would be my grandparents.
sentences.chinese: 在夏历新年，我的家庭都将我的祖怙恃。

sentences.english: I couldn't help thinking of his parents at the sight of the orphan.
sentences.chinese: 一看到阿谁孤女，我便没有由自顿时念起了他的怙恃。

sentences.english: Of course I must make good use of it; otherwise I would incur the displeasure of my parents.
sentences.chinese: 自然我须好好利用它，不然我会招致怙恃的悲痛。

sentences.english: Happiness is hearing your parents' strories memories.
sentences.chinese: 幸运便是，听怙恃讲那曩昔的事。

sentences.english: My parents like to to the shopping centre.
sentences.chinese: 我的怙恃周终念要去购物中心。

sentences.english: Till my parents and my only brother where killed in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 直到自己地怙恃和独一地兄弟死于车祸。

sentences.english: Jane's being engaged to Black made her parents very angry…
sentences.chinese: 简将与布莱克订亲，这使她地怙恃很生气。

sentences.english: I visit my grandparents every week.
sentences.chinese: 我每1个星期都去看祖怙恃。

sentences.english: I agree with your parents that it is better for you to go home earlier.
sentences.chinese: 我同意你怙恃的观点，你最好早点回家。

sentences.english: If she were trying harder, her parents wouldn't be so anxious.
sentences.chinese: 如果她此刻更用功些，她的怙恃也不会恁地忧虑了。

sentences.english: Two years later, he left his parents and entered a medical college.
sentences.chinese: 两年后，他离开怙恃进入一所医学院学习。

sentences.english: I go back to our hometown with my parents once a year.
sentences.chinese: 我每年和我怙恃回我们家乡一次。

sentences.english: However, your parents early on a winter vacation to make you a tutorial.
sentences.chinese: 但是，你的怙恃早早地给你报了寒假补习班。

definition: to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
father and elder brother(s)/head of the family/patriarch
